title: The WHITE FLAG, One Last Time
body_text:
CARTY, TRONOLONE - "White Flag" Encounter!
With an embarrassing 14 losses between the two, veteran high-flyers
Derek Carty
and
John Tronolone
have suffered more physical pain and mental anguish than any other dodgeball combatants, specifically in the captains chair. With nearly three years of experience, one would think they'd turn such misfortune into a pot of gold. But luck - and "The Writer" - just wouldn't allow such a change to occur.
Here in the preview of their August 2nd confrontation, we take a stroll down memory lane as to why these long-time great competitors just can't cut the mustard as leading generals.
DEREK CARTY
Wins
: (0)
Ties
: (0)
Losses
: (6)
XIV
(14)
..

..

..

(112)
Defeated by
: Ben Cotta, Joey Kelly, Sara DeCuir, Chris Adams, Dan Spengeman, Michael Edwards
Notes
: has only competed in standard singles matches
JOHN TRONOLONE
Wins
: (4) 35 .. LIX
(59)
.. LX
(60)

ONE-SEVENTEEN
Defeated
: Kevin Fitzpatrick (35), Chris Adams (LIX), Dan Spengeman and Sara DeCuir (LX), Valerie Winston (131)
Defeated by
: Chris Adams (9, 79), Jim Martin (20), Kevin Megill (30, 79), Kevin Adams (49, LXXXI, 100), Valerie Winston (LXXXI), Justin Pierce (100), Michael Edwards (100), Tom Adams (ONE-SEVENTEEN).
Notes
: has competed in singles, two-person team, and three-person team battles; failed to win any of his matches in the entire 2007 year; lost both the first
BoxBall Dodgeball
and
CREAMation Rules
encounters
Could it possibly get any more pathetic? "The Writer" does not hesitate in simply saying "These guys suck!" And luckily for one of them, it all comes to an end.
For the first time - and last - high-flyin', award-winning legend
Derek Carty
battles the self-proclaimed "Creation"
John Tronolone
at the doorstep of 150, DODGEBALL CXLIX, on August 2.
________________________________________
_________
It's been a long time coming ladies and gentlemen, but here it is ...
The rumors are true - legendary megastar
Tom Adams
will be unable to fill his duties as one of the six DODGEBALL 150 captains. His replacement will be the sport's most reckless individual, former season finale headliner
Travis Mills
. But that's not all.
What was once a standard three-versus-three confrontation
(Stopa/T. Adams/DiBuccio - Vetrano/Bertsch/Londono)
has been altered for your viewing pleasure. For the first time in
EastCoastDodgeball
history, the maniacal men clash with the fury of the females!
BOBBY VETRANO, TRAVIS MILLS, JUAN LONDONO
VS.
ALISON BERTSCH, LAUREN STOPA, DIANA DIBUCCIO
DODGEBALL 150 just got a hell of a lot sweeter! And don't forget about the returning "MoneyMaker" Rimshot Contest, the Spengeman-Tronolone soundtrack, and the special appearances of full-time dodgeballers' family and friends! It all goes down
August 9
beginning at
5pm
!
body_html:
CARTY, TRONOLONE - "White Flag" Encounter!
With an embarrassing 14 losses between the two, veteran high-flyers Derek Carty and John Tronolone have suffered more physical pain and mental anguish than any other dodgeball combatants, specifically in the captains chair. With nearly three years of experience, one would think they'd turn such misfortune into a pot of gold. But luck - and "The Writer" - just wouldn't allow such a change to occur.

Here in the preview of their August 2nd confrontation, we take a stroll down memory lane as to why these long-time great competitors just can't cut the mustard as leading generals.

DEREK CARTY
Wins: (0)
Ties: (0)
Losses: (6) XIV (14) .. 41 .. 47 .. 53 .. 89 .. CX2 (112)
Defeated by: Ben Cotta, Joey Kelly, Sara DeCuir, Chris Adams, Dan Spengeman, Michael Edwards
Notes: has only competed in standard singles matches

JOHN TRONOLONE
Wins: (4) 35 .. LIX (59) .. LX (60) .. 131
Ties: (0)
Losses: (8) 9 .. 20 .. 30 .. 49 .. 79 .. LXXXI (81) .. 100 .. ONE-SEVENTEEN
Defeated: Kevin Fitzpatrick (35), Chris Adams (LIX), Dan Spengeman and Sara DeCuir (LX), Valerie Winston (131)
Defeated by: Chris Adams (9, 79), Jim Martin (20), Kevin Megill (30, 79), Kevin Adams (49, LXXXI, 100), Valerie Winston (LXXXI), Justin Pierce (100), Michael Edwards (100), Tom Adams (ONE-SEVENTEEN).
Notes: has competed in singles, two-person team, and three-person team battles; failed to win any of his matches in the entire 2007 year; lost both the first BoxBall Dodgeball and CREAMation Rules encounters

Could it possibly get any more pathetic? "The Writer" does not hesitate in simply saying "These guys suck!" And luckily for one of them, it all comes to an end.

For the first time - and last - high-flyin', award-winning legend Derek Carty battles the self-proclaimed "Creation" John Tronolone at the doorstep of 150, DODGEBALL CXLIX, on August 2.

_________________________________________________




It's been a long time coming ladies and gentlemen, but here it is ...

The rumors are true - legendary megastar Tom Adams will be unable to fill his duties as one of the six DODGEBALL 150 captains. His replacement will be the sport's most reckless individual, former season finale headliner Travis Mills. But that's not all.

What was once a standard three-versus-three confrontation (Stopa/T. Adams/DiBuccio - Vetrano/Bertsch/Londono) has been altered for your viewing pleasure. For the first time in EastCoastDodgeball history, the maniacal men clash with the fury of the females!

BOBBY VETRANO, TRAVIS MILLS, JUAN LONDONO
VS.
ALISON BERTSCH, LAUREN STOPA, DIANA DIBUCCIO

DODGEBALL 150 just got a hell of a lot sweeter! And don't forget about the returning "MoneyMaker" Rimshot Contest, the Spengeman-Tronolone soundtrack, and the special appearances of full-time dodgeballers' family and friends! It all goes down August 9 beginning at 5pm!
